intro: Malacothrix squalida, commonly known as the rough hairpin, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
